Package controllers

Class EntityController

java.lang.Object
controllers.Controller
controllers.EntityController
public class EntityController
extends Controller
The EntityController class handles the adding, removal, updating and drawing of onscreen elements, such as SnakeEntity and ApplePickup.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected java.util.LinkedList<Entity> entities
    The entities currently registered inside this controller; they'll receive requests to update and redraw themselves
    protected java.util.LinkedList<Entity> entitiesToDestroy
    Entities to be destroyed after the end of the next update cycle
    protected java.util.LinkedList<Entity> entitiesToSpawn
    Entities to be spawned at the beginning of an update cycle
    protected int playerCount
    The amount of players registered inside the EntityController

    Fields inherited from class controllers.Controller

    gameInstance

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    EntityController​(SnakeGame g)
    Instantiates the controller with the SnakeGame instance to be used later

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void destroyPickup​(Pickup p)
    Queues the given Pickup instance to be destroyed from the controller
    protected void destroyPickups()
    Destroys all entities that have been queued to be removed
    SnakeEntity getPlayer​(int playerId)
    Fetches the SnakeEntity instance belonging to the Player with ID playerId
    void initWithPlayers​(Player[] players)
    Initiates the EntityController with the players provided.
    void keyPressed​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent event)
    Handles incoming key presses by dispatching them to the players currently registered
    void redraw()
    Redraws all entities currently registered
    void spawnPickup​(Pickup e, java.awt.Point p)
    Spawns the Pickup instance at the Point provided by setting the x and y position of the Pickup to that of the Point provided
    void spawnPickupRandom​(Pickup e)
    Given a Pickup instance, this function generates a random point for it, ensuring that the pickup is clear of any other entities inside the game.
    protected void spawnPickups()
    Spawns any entities that are currently queued
    void update​(double dt)
    Spawns any entities that are currently queued, and then send an update tick to all currently registered.

    • playerCount

      protected int playerCount
      The amount of players registered inside the EntityController

    • entities

      protected final java.util.LinkedList<Entity> entities
      The entities currently registered inside this controller; they'll receive requests to update and redraw themselves
      See Also:

      Entities to be destroyed after the end of the next update cycle

  • Constructor Details

    • EntityController

      public EntityController​(SnakeGame g)
      Instantiates the controller with the SnakeGame instance to be used later
      Parameters:
      g - The current SnakeGame instace

  • Method Details

    • initWithPlayers

      public void initWithPlayers​(Player[] players)
      Initiates the EntityController with the players provided.
      Parameters:
      players - The Player instances to be used when initiating this controller

    • update

      public void update​(double dt)
      Spawns any entities that are currently queued, and then send an update tick to all currently registered. After completion, remove any entities that have been queued for removal
      Parameters:
      dt - Time passed since last tick
      See Also:
      entities, entitiesToSpawn, entitiesToDestroy

    • redraw

      public void redraw()
      Redraws all entities currently registered
      See Also:
      entities

    • destroyPickups

      protected void destroyPickups()
      Destroys all entities that have been queued to be removed
      See Also:
      entitiesToDestroy

    • spawnPickups

      protected void spawnPickups()
      Spawns any entities that are currently queued
      See Also:
      entitiesToSpawn

    • getPlayer

      public SnakeEntity getPlayer​(int playerId)
      Fetches the SnakeEntity instance belonging to the Player with ID playerId
      Parameters:
      playerId - The ID of the player connected to the snake we're trying to fetch
      Returns:
      Returns the matching SnakeEntity, or null if no match was found

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent event)
      Handles incoming key presses by dispatching them to the players currently registered
      Parameters:
      event - The KeyEvent to be dispatched
      See Also:
      getPlayer(int)

    • spawnPickupRandom

      public void spawnPickupRandom​(Pickup e)
      Given a Pickup instance, this function generates a random point for it, ensuring that the pickup is clear of any other entities inside the game.
      Parameters:
      e - The Pickup instance to be spawned

    • spawnPickup

      public void spawnPickup​(Pickup e, java.awt.Point p)
      Spawns the Pickup instance at the Point provided by setting the x and y position of the Pickup to that of the Point provided
      Parameters:
      e - The Pickup instance to be spawned
      p - The Point to be used to place the Pickup

    • destroyPickup

      public void destroyPickup​(Pickup p)
      Queues the given Pickup instance to be destroyed from the controller
      Parameters:
      p - The Pickup instance to be removed
      See Also:
      destroyPickups()
